b.em: Services to be delivered by Primus Auditing Operations

div.p:
Estimated Travel Expenses: - Travel expenses are estimated and are subject to change based on actual travel expenses incurred.
Travel expenses are on a direct reimbursement basis and include all expenses for transportation, accommodation and meals. Whenever possible, trips are combined with other business and expenses are divided to reduce the total costs for all of our customers
1. DELIVERY. Audit reports an information related to the audit are shared through the SEDEX Platform.

2. TRANSFER OF DATA TO OUTSIDE PARTIES. Primus Auditing Ops may be required to submit information obtained during the audit to either Supplier Ethical Data Exchange ("SEDEX") and/or to the Association of Professional Social Compliance Auditors (“APSCA”) for its authorized use. By executing this Agreement, Customer acknowledges that such information may be provided to the applicable SEDEX and/or APSCA, and consents to the transfer of such information.

3. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. Customer hereby releases Primus Auditing Ops, its employees, directors, principals, agents, and affiliates, from any loss or liability suffered by Customer, resulting from services performed under this Agreement. Such release shall include any actual, incidental, consequential or other damages beyond amounts paid to Primus Auditing Ops for auditing performed and/or facilitated by Primus Auditing Ops. Customer further acknowledges and agrees that Primus Auditing Ops' liability is limited only to the audit work performed by it, and the parties expressly acknowledge that Primus Auditing Ops is not liable for Customer's commodity, its safety, or quality.

4. GOVERNING LAW / VENUE. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California. In the event that it is necessary to institute any action to enforce any right granted herein or to redress any alleged breach hereof, then the exclusive venue for such action shall reside with the Superior Court located in Santa Maria, California.

5. RIGHT TO REFERRAL. Customer acknowledges that Primus Auditing Ops is, or may, contract out the auditing services performed for Customer. Because an independent auditor is engaged in his/her own independent contracting business and is not an employee of Primus Auditing Ops, if Primus Auditing Ops refers the audit out to a contractor, it will not obtain insurance (professional liability, workers' compensation, general liability, auto, etc.) for the auditor or his/her/its employees. Independent auditors agree by a separate referral agreement to obtain his/her own insurance coverage and furnish a copy of the certificate of insurance to Primus Auditing Ops. Furthermore, in those instances in which an independent auditor is retained, Primus Auditing Ops will be acting in the sole capacity of independent contractor and any information or data received will be merely transmitted between parties, making no independent judgment, representations or warranties as to the facts, observations or inferences made relative to same.

6. AUDIT AND SURVEILLANCE. Customer agrees and acknowledges free access is required to be made for any scheduled audit, as well as possible random quality assurance checks (depending on the audit scheme's requirements) of customer's operation including but not limited to: examination of documentation, records, and access to the equipment, location(s), area(s), personnel, and full physical inspection of Customer's subcontractors. Customer agrees to allow observers from Primus Auditing Ops and/or varying governing bodies if customer's audit or certification is randomly selected for surveillance for quality assurance purposes. Customer further agrees to grant free access in order to verify continued compliance with certification. Customer acknowledges complaints related to compliance must be documented, and subsequent investigation of complaints is possible, and in some cases may be mandatory. Documentation of complaints and investigation may be subject to inspection during audit or surveillance or at the request or Primus Auditing Ops at any time. Customer acknowledges that its failure to fully comply with this section, either during the time of audit or any other time during the certification period, is a material breach of this agreement and can result in Customer's certification being revoked without further notification. The Customer understands and agrees to perform Follow-up Audits when corrective actions cannot be verified in a desk review, for example, in the event of critical non-compliances.

7. CUSTOMER OBLIGATIONS. The Customer agrees to comply with the points cited in the SMETA audit, under the Ethical Trading Initiative Base Code (ETI), as well as the applicable local Laws. Any deviation detected during the audit will be reported and indicated during the closing meeting and in the corresponding document (CARP), for which Customer must take corrective actions to cure the deviation, and is responsible for entering them into the SEDEX platform Customer's corrective actions, as well as entering them into the SEDEX platform is the sole responsibility of the Customer, to which Customer acknowledges, understands, and agrees.

In the event that a new on-site visit is required to verify corrective actions as determined in the closing meeting of the corresponding audit, the Customer agrees in advance to pay all costs related to said visit, namely travel expenses, mileage, auditor and administrative expenses. Primus Auditing Operations, for this purpose, will send an individual quote accordingly.

Customer further agrees:
Customer must deliver the Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) at least 15 days prior to the date of the onsite visit/ audit. Likewise, you must provide the ZC and ZS registration numbers to Primus Auditing Ops at least 5 days before the audit, otherwise the audit will be rescheduled and the per diem payment is subject to the assigned auditor having made any expenses prior to the audit cancellation either by the client or due to lack of registration on the Sedex platform.
Customer is responsible for managing all the logistics necessary to carry out the audit and evaluation by representatives of Primus Auditing Ops, which includes access to records, documentation, facilities and everything that is necessary to verify compliance with the regulations and requirements pursuant to SMETA Customer is responsible for compliance with SMETA and the guidelines of the Ethical Trade Initiative Base Code (ETI), undertakes to carry out all the activities necessary to maintain compliance after the audit, as well as the implementation of measures consistent with the continuous improvement in accordance with the conditions reflected in the Audit Report.
Customer agrees to inform Primus Auditing Ops of any change in the operation that may affect the Client's ability to comply with the audit requirements or that generates a significant change in the way the client performs its activities.
Customer agrees to apply the corrective actions within the time period agreed to during the closing meeting with the auditor. In the event that it is unable to apply or otherwise the corrective actions, it will submit the situation in writing to both Primus Auditing Ops and the auditor.
Customer agrees to act in good faith and inform Primus Auditing Operations in writing of any significant change that contravenes the provisions of the ETI Base Code evaluated.
Customer agrees to have representatives from senior management, managers responsible for key functions (for example HR and production) and trade unions / workers' representatives at the time of the onsite audit.
Customer agrees to give the auditor full access to the applicable audited operation, documents and personnel during the onsite visit in order to perform the SMETA audit.
If an auditor has Full Access Denied, the auditor shall trigger an alert in all cases. If the auditor is able to enter the site but cannot access any of the necessary information, they shall raise an alert and a Non-Compliance.
If an auditor has Partial Access Denied, the auditor shall continue with the audit, but raise a Non-Compliance with a detailed description of the issue(s).

8. AUDIT RESULTS. The Client must comply with the following:
The client agrees to always comply with the requirements of the methodology.
The client shall comply by implementing the appropriate changes when communicated through Primus Auditing Ops to the client.

The client acknowledges that it cannot make assertions regarding the audit results that are inconsistent with the scope of the audit performed. Furthermore, the client may not use the audit results in a misleading or unauthorized manner, or in a manner that damages the reputation of Primus Auditing Ops. In addition, the client acknowledges that the times for closing non-conformities should be discussed during the closing of the audit with the auditor so that they are established in the CAPR Corrective actions report.

9. CONFIDENTIALITY. Primus Auditing Ops hereby represents and agrees that all information obtained or developed in connection with any audit performed under this Agreement, and for any audit performed for social compliance or otherwise governed by APSCA shall be kept confidential and shall not be disclosed to any party other than Customer, except in the following circumstances:
Customer requests and/or authorizes Primus Auditing Ops, in writing, to release such information to a specific third party; or
Where disclosure of such information to a third party is required in order for Primus Auditing Ops to perform and execute the services under this Agreement; or,
Primus Auditing Ops is required, pursuant to applicable and governing laws or regulation (by deposition, interrogatories, requests for information or documents in legal proceedings, subpoena, civil investigative demand or similar process), to disclose any or all of such obtained information; and in such case, only to the extent required by law; or,
Disclosure of such obtained information is required by Primus Auditing Ops to obtain legal or ethical advice regarding compliance with applicable laws, applicable codes and/or standards. Where confidentiality is not governed by a recognized professional code of conduct, an appropriate non-disclosure agreement must be executed by the third party prior to disclosure of such information; or,
Disclosure is required to establish a claim or defense by Primus Auditing Ops in an adversarial proceeding.

ul.li: Termination for Cause. This Service Agreement shall be indefinite, ending at the time of expiration of Customer's Certification. If either party fails to fulfill any term or condition of this Agreement, such failure shall be considered a breach of this Agreement. The breaching party shall have 10 calendar days from the time of receipt of written notice from the other party to cure such breach. If after 10 days, the breaching party has not cured the breach, the non-breaching party may terminate this Agreement with no further obligations. The 10-day notice provision and termination is not applicable to violation of the Trademark use, as described in Section 11 herein - where the cure time upon notice will be 15 days.

Voluntary Termination. Either party may voluntarily terminate this Agreement upon fifteen days' written notice to the other party. If this Agreement is terminated by either party, all certifications granted by Primus Audit Ops to Customer after such termination shall not be valid.

Audits performed by Mexico Office. For all Audits scheduled with and performed by the Primus Auditing Ops office in Mexico, Customer agrees it shall pay the total audit fees prior to the scheduling and performance of the Audit. The total audit fee may include, but not limited to audit fee, admin fees, report entry times, travel time, evidence review, and travel expenses. Primus Auditing Ops will not schedule or perform any audit under this Agreement prior to receipt of full payment for audit fees.

Audits performed by US, Chile, and Costa Rica Offices. For all Audits scheduled with and performed by Primus Auditing Ops' offices in the United States of America, Chile, or Costa Rica; Customer agrees of hall pay 50% of the total audit fees must be paid in full prior to the scheduling and performance of the Audit. The total audit fee may include, but not limited to audit fee, admin fees, report entry times, travel time, evidence review, and travel expenses.
Customer agrees to pay Primus Auditing Ops the outstanding balance within 30 days or receipt of invoice from Primus Auditing Ops remaining amount. The total audit fee might include but not limited to audit fee, admin fees, report entry times, travel time, evidence review, and travel expenses.

div.p: 12. CANCELLATION FEES. If Customer cancels or otherwise reschedules a scheduled audit date, it acknowledges, understands, and agrees that Customer shall be responsible for all non-refundable travel costs incurred by Primus Auditing Ops associated with that audit. In addition to any incurred travel costs, any change or cancellation of an audit by Customer that occurs within 15 business days of the scheduled audit will be charged a cancellation fee of 50% of the audit. If, on the day of the audit, the auditor or any representative of Primus Auditing Ops is denied access to the field, facilities, or any area necessary to perform the audit, Customer understands, acknowledges, and agrees that it shall be responsible for all audit fees quoted herein, in addition to all travel costs.

13. LOGO and URN. The guidelines for the usage of the Sedex Member Logo can be found on their website (www.sedex.com) and in the document titled Sedex Ambassador toolkit. The Customer must not misuse the SMETA report, CAPR and/or URN.
